page.title: 19STATISTICS OF THE SCHOOL
page.content: Children in their first and final years were questioned about school life. In the first school all children except 2 looked forward to school, (these 2 had not attended playschool). All the children enjoyed school, particularly the number and language games. The children are taught in groups of ability. A television with video-recorder is used to stimulate discussion and provides a basis for work programmes. Most children had started a reading book, 10 play a musical instrument and 4 can swim. The two classes in the final year are taught by five different teachers still in their class groups. Pupils develop definite 'subject choices'. These pupils do not watch television. They are all able to swim, and only four are still learning a musical instrument.
